original_title: Sri Lanka’s palmyrah toddy sees demand from France, Canada, Dubai
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s Palmyrah Development Board earned US$102,422 (32.2 million rupees) from the export of palmyrah toddy in 2023, according to a statement by the Government Department of Information.
The highest demand for palmyrah toddy, produced in the country’s north, has come from Canada and France.
Marketed as Sri Lanka Palmyra, it also has seen demand from Dubai, the DGI statement said.

“This is another agricultural project that can provide the country with foreign exchange, if properly developed,” Minister of Agriculture and Plantation Industries, Mahinda Amaraweera was quoted as saying at a progress review meeting of the institutions under the Ministry of Plantations held last Friday (5).
Amaraweera instructed officials to do more to promote palmyrah products internationally.

Other products from the palmyrah tree have also brought in foreign exchange: the export of palmyra pulp has earned 3 million rupees, Odial flour 2.9 million rupees, Pulukodial Flour 8 lakh rupees, palm succulents 2.6 million rupees, and palm jaggery 2.6 million rupees. (Colombo/Jan8/2024)
